channel.title: design on DWH Academy Posts
channel.description: Recent content in design on DWH Academy Posts

item.title: Naming Standards
item.description: The main goal of adopting a naming convention for database objects is so that you and others can easily identify the type and purpose of all objects contained in the database. In this article, I want to describe one of the possible ways of adopting naming standards, undoubtedly there are other standards that also work but my goal is to show you the ones I applied and they proved to be working very well.

item.title: Proven DWH Design
item.description: There is an unlimited number of ways how to build a data warehouse. Few of them work and some of the few can even survive in the long term. In this post, we are going to describe the high-level design of the typical successful DWH in the long term. Landing Area Imagine the Landing Area as an address, where the files from the source systems arrive. It is the first interface of the DWH, usually some file system organized into directories for each source file.
